did.unittitle: William R. Coleman collection of New York City waterfront pollution slides
did.abstract: The collection contains 147 35mm color transparency slides of pollution along Newtown Creek, the East River, the Hudson River, and other New York City waterfront areas, taken by William R. Coleman when he was working as a student assistant in the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in 1971. The photographs were taken while he toured the harbor with the Army Corps of Engineers.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: An index to the slides is available in the collection's accession file. Please consult library staff for more information.
